title: Lesson 84
paragraph: This lesson focuses on society and change, highlighting reformist, progressive, and activist approaches.

words.meaning: seeking to improve or reform society
words.example: The reformist policies modernized the education system.

words.meaning: involving or causing a complete or dramatic change
words.example: The invention was revolutionary in technology.

words.meaning: favoring social reform or new ideas
words.example: The government implemented progressive laws for equality.

words.meaning: opposing political or social progress or reform
words.example: The reactionary group resisted the new policies.
He holds conservative views on social issues.

words.meaning: someone who campaigns for social or political change
words.example: The activist fought for human rights.

words.meaning: believing in equality for all people
words.example: The egalitarian society valued every citizen equally.

words.meaning: favoring individual freedom and minimal government control
words.example: He held libertarian views on governance.

words.meaning: appealing to the interests and conceptions of ordinary people
words.example: The populist movement gained widespread support.
